title: Appalachian National Scenic Trail: Current Conditions
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Current Conditions             Alerts & Conditions         Alerts    Caution        Heat Advisory  Alert 1 , Severity ,caution ,, Heat Advisory  A few tips for summer hiking safety - Drink from two to four cups of water every hour while hiking. Don’t wait until you are thirsty to drink. Pace activity – start slow and pick up the pace gradually. Avoid the mid-day heat and hike early or late. more     Information        Bear Activity High - Numerous A.T. Shelters Closed  Alert 1 , Severity ,information ,, Bear Activity High - Numerous A.T. Shelters Closed  Several shelters and camp sites are currently closed along the Appalachian Trail due to bear activity. Store food properly and be bear aware! For bear safety info  https://www.nps.gov/grsm/learn/nature/black-bears.htm Click "more" for trail-wide updates. more
